intro: Dolomiaea souliei var. souliei, commonly known as the Sulié's dolomiaea, is a rare and striking member of the Aizoaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Native to the arid regions of southern Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Its foliage consists of fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, aiding in water retention. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is highly sought after by succulent enthusiasts and botanists alike.
